title: Jenkins Commission (EU)
text:
The Jenkins Commission was the <a href="European%20Commission">European Commission</a> that held office from 6 January 1977 to 6 January 1981. Its <a href="President%20of%20the%20European%20Commission">President</a> was <a href="Roy%20Jenkins">Roy Jenkins</a>.
Work.
It was the successor to the <a href="Ortoli%20Commission">Ortoli Commission</a> and was succeeded by the <a href="Thorn%20Commission">Thorn Commission</a>. Despite stagnating growth and a higher energy bill, the Jenkins Commission oversaw the development of the <a href="Economic%20and%20Monetary%20Union%20of%20the%20European%20Union">Economic and Monetary Union of the European Union</a> from 1977, which began in 1979 as the <a href="European%20Monetary%20System">European Monetary System</a>, a forerunner of the Single Currency or <a href="euro">euro</a>. President Jenkins was the first President to attend a <a href="G8">G8</a> summit on behalf of the Community.
Membership.
Summary by political leanings.
